venue_post_title: Half of Friday's at the ROM

venue_dna_review: nothing to say here
so cool!
really great for a date
romantic!

venue_dna_excerpt: A romantic, stylish, yet surprisingly cozy restaurant, where sharing is caring as each dish is served tapas style, so you and your date can sample multiple dishes of delicious food together.
venue_dna_review:
Stylish, artsy, spacious and comfortable Ð this is the vibe Nyood gives off the second you step foot into this restaurant, which serves Ônouveau mediterraneanÓ cuisine spearheaded by chef Roger Mooking of Food TV fame.

Nyood offers a tapas style menu, where each plate is meant to be shared between two to three people. Some of the offerings include a selection of tasty flatbreads topped with duck prosciutto or Iberico ham. As well, there are many seafood options and vegetarian options. The menu includes a detailed mouth-watering description of each dish, so you know exactly what youÕre getting and how itÕs prepared.

Take note of the restaurantÕs decor, with its high ceilings,huge sky-high bookshelf filled with literary classics and floral-like chandeliers hanging over the expansive bar, as well as many different artsy light fixtures throughout. You will also notice the floral-like plaster mouldings etched into the ceiling, creating a beautiful, artistic, and intricately decorated space from ceiling to floor.

This is a great spot for a romantic date night, with great food, cocktails, and service. We heard the Sangrias were to die for! Request a private corner table away from the main entrance if you desire more privacy to enjoy your meal. Tables range from very open, next to the bar to cozy corners for couples, and is also suitable for larger parties.

Nyood Bar is also a great place for after hour drinks, open Thursday through Saturday of each week. This Queen West venue is a place to be seen with the chic, trendy and stylish bunch of this city.

venue_dna_excerpt: A date idea for museum and gallery lovers who are looking for an alternative from the ROM or the AGO, this under the radar museum is the place for you.
venue_dna_review:
Here's a date idea for those who enjoy going to museums and art galleries, but rather not visit the ROM or the AGO. The Textile Museum of Canada is one of those museums in Toronto that few people know about, mainly due to it's smaller size.

Hidden away on a small side street not far between the Toronto Eaton Centre and the Art Gallery of Ontario, the museum is home to more than 12,000 objects from over 200 countries and regions.

The TMC's permanent collection celebrates cultural diversity and includes traditional fabrics, garments, carpets and related artifacts. They also host contemporary exhibitions of the work of Canadian and international artists. You can expect to find a new exhibit at the TMC about every six months.

General admission is $15 per person, but on Wednesdays from 5:00pm to 8:00pm it is "pay what you can".

venue_dna_excerpt: Break away from the mould of big box chain of movie theatres from AMC, Cineplex and Famous Players and get back to the basics by playing movies that aren't just for the mainstream crowd.
venue_dna_review:
Changing hands and changing names over the last few years, Toronto Underground Cinema prides itself on showcasing genre classics, B movie greats, indie art house and the pick of the best current Hollywood flicks.

They break away from the mould of big box chain of movie theatres from AMC, Cineplex and Famous Players and get back to the basics of the the "Grindhouse" feel of the 70's and 80's by playing movies that aren't just for the mainstream crowd.

venue_dna_excerpt: Bored of sedentary movie and dinner dates? Why not challenge yourself and your date to an evening of great heights rock climbing?
venue_dna_review:
Challenge yourself and your date to an evening of great heights at the Rock Oasis. If you're looking for a date idea that sets itself apart form your usual sedentary  dinner and movie ritual, then this is the place for you.

This activity is suitable for everybody, from beginner level climbers to the very experienced. There are friendly trainers on site to help those first time climbers off their feet.

With more than 60 routes and more than 50 boulder problems for you to climb your way through, you can easily spend an entire evening here having fun challenging each other and getting in shape together at the same time.

venue_dna_excerpt: A step up from all the other cheap "all you can eat" sushi joints in Toronto, Sushi Couture impresses with their fresh sushi and omakase offerings to delight and tantalize Japanese food lovers' taste buds.
venue_dna_review:
The AnnexÕ newest Japanese restaurant Sushi Couture, spearheaded by the husband and wife team, Chef Ken (former Head Chef of Japango) and his wife Helen has moved into the higher-end sushi space in order to differentiate itself. TheyÕve become a quiet hit amongst the foodie scene after opening their doors back in early September.

The dŽcor is definitely a step up from their numerous competitors in the area where theyÕve opted to set their space up with many booths to help make the experience feel a little more intimate.

venue_dna_excerpt: A perfect place to take your date for a sweet dessert, while inhaling in the decadently dizzying aroma of cocoa beans roasting.
venue_dna_review:
There's no sweeter place than a chocolate factory. SoMa is one of the city's premier chocolate makers, creating fine artisan chocolates in delicate little batches right from the heart of the Distillery District, using organic ingredients.

This is a place for those who truly worship chocolate. Upon entering this quaint little shop, you will see a couple of tables and chairs set up, an area serving fresh-made gelato, a drinks station and counters full of yummy chocolate products from bars to nuts to cookies.

What's special about SoMa is visitors can see the whole magical process of how their chocolate is made through their kitchen, which is visible to all. There's nothing really fancy about this simple space but don't let the decor fool you from having a sweet date here.

SoMa serves one of the best cups of chocolates in the city, according to several prolific city blogs and magazines. This is the perfect place to take your date for a sweet dessert, while inhaling in the decadently dizzying aroma of cocoa beans roasting.

venue_dna_excerpt: Fresh Oysters have long been considered aphrodisiacs, and this romantic and cozy restaurant will surely help put you in the right mood.
venue_dna_review:
Some say, fresh Oysters are consider an aphrodisiac, so for those looking to slurp back a couple of these raw sea delicacies, Pure Spirits Oyster House is the place.

One of the city's most popular oyster and fresh seafood restaurants, Pure Spirits is a beautiful, warm and cozy spot, full of history and fine food.

The historic building where the eatery resides is long and narrow with soft-lighting, set with cozy and private booths for two, and small tables comfortable for smaller groups.

There is also an expansive 28-seat bar at the front, where all the entertaining Oyster-shucking action happens, so ask to be seated at the bar if you want a front row seat to watch this.

If you're a newbie to this delicacy, the staff will gladly guide you through this experience and recommend the right oyster for you (there are many kinds), so you will not be too overwhelmed. The restaurant is constantly packed, so reservations are highly recommended at all times.

Pure Spirits also holds the title of one of the city's best outdoor patios.

venue_dna_excerpt: A beautiful historic area, with brick-lined streets and restored Victorian-era buildings , closed off from outside traffic, containing some of the city's best restaurants, bars, and cafes.
venue_dna_review:
Upon entering through the gates and onto the brick-lined streets, Toronto's revitalized Distillery Historic District can transport you into a romantic area surrounded by some of the city's best restaurants, bars, and cafes. The establishments are all set inside restored Victorian-era buildings, in a closed-off area from the busy city streets downtown.

It is also a great place to take a stroll, just window shopping or peeking into the district's many artsy shops and boutiques. There are art galleries, live theatre house, jewelry stores and home decor stores, as well as common areas outside along the store fronts for you to sit and have a conversation with your date while sipping on a decadent hot chocolate from SOMA Chocolatiers.

The area is very popular with tourists, completely closed off to traffic, but even the steady stream of visitors won't have you feeling much distraction. Also a beautiful spot in the evening for a quiet walk and stargazing on a clear night.

venue_dna_excerpt: The perfect spot for those looking for a quiet and intimate eatery, serving up local fare with a European twist.
venue_dna_review:
This quaint and casual bar and bistro is a favourite with the Riverside/Leslieville communities, serving fresh seasonal Canadian, locally grown and organic dishes, with a European influence. They also have a great wine selection, and offer up an amazing charcuterie plate.

This is the perfect spot for those looking for a quiet and intimate eatery in the East end to enjoy a great meal. The interior is complimented by soft lighting, comfortable seating and well spaced out tables to ensure privacy yet the huge glass window at the front of the restaurant allows for people watching along Queen Street East as you dine.

They also offer private dining options.

venue_dna_excerpt: The first thing youÕll notice about upon setting eyes on this coffee spot are the rows of chairs lined up like bleachers to take in the spectacular view that is Riverdale Park.
venue_dna_review:
Simply known as ÒThe RoosterÓ, the first thing youÕll notice about upon setting eyes on this coffee spot are the rows of chairs lined up like bleachers to take in the spectacle that is Riverdale Park.

Shawn, one of the co-owners of this place, whom I immediately recognized and vice versa as she used to be a Te Aro compatriot before opening The Rooster. A lot of thought has been put into the decor of this spot. From their comfy leather chairs that you can sink into while immersed in conversation to their communal table filled with board games to allow you the opportunity to kick each otherÕs asses in Scrabble. I couldnÕt describe a better coffee date spot than The Rooster.

Anyone whoÕs looking to check out awesome independent coffee spots across in the east end of Toronto should definitely check out The Rooster.

venue_dna_excerpt: This Yorkville-based sushi restaurant has been a favourite with Torontonians for a decade now.
venue_dna_review:
This Yorkville-based sushi restaurant has been a favourite with Torontonians for a decade now. Friendly, quaint and unpretentious despite being situated next to all the high-end eateries and boutiques along Cumberland Avenue, Sushi Inn offers fresh, no-fuss sushi at an attractive price point.

Great spot if you're looking to just grab a causal meal with an ethnic touch. The restaurant is situated on multi-floors in a narrow building, with expansive windows looking out onto the street. The decor is low-key and not all that fancy, but still impresses with its friendly service and tasty dishes.

venue_dna_excerpt: This cleverly named cafŽ nixes the laptops and brings you into an environment where you're encourage to be act like a kid again with their vast collection of boardgames.
venue_dna_review:
What do you get when you fuse a cafŽ with 1500 board games? Snakes and Lattes of course!

After opening up for a little under a week, the cleverly named cafŽ has become the media darling as of late embraced by the Toronto twitter and blogosphere after garnering a slew of rave reviews.

This is the brandchild of owners AurŽlia and Ben, who are originally from France. They spotted a business opportunity in the Toronto cafŽ scene after seeing the Òboard game cafŽÓ concept take off in South Korea and France but has yet to swoop in here.ItÕs a simple formula -- combining a cafŽ with board games (1500 and counting).

When you take into account that they donÕt exactly encourage the use of laptops or provide free wifi like many other cafŽs, you'll quickly understand why Torontonians are flocking to this haven of board games, fine coffee which is providing patrons with a nostalgic flashback of simpler times gone by.

You can ÒPlay all dayÓ for $5 per person or play for free with their featured board game of the day, while you sip on your latte or beer. They also serve freshly prepared French-influenced appetizers and finger foods.

Some of their recommended Òdate gamesÓ have been Gravitas , HedBanz , and Apples to Apples. If youÕre feeling a little bit more risquŽ and wanting to raise the stakes, they have games such as Adult Trivia and Dirty Minds to encourage some not as clean as a whistle fun if you catch our drift.

After talking to the baristas of the cafŽ, Giordano and Joe, they had remarked that despite being open for a short while, theyÕve witnessed the power of board games bringing people together, seeing spontaneous triple dates occur after a competitive game of Settlers of Catan had taken shape at the back of the cafŽ where their cushy couches are. ThatÕs the kind of fun you should expect upon stepping this innovative cafŽ and fantastic date spot.

venue_dna_excerpt: This iconic restaurant situated in a Victorian house in the heart of Yorkville offers French inspired Canadian cuisine in a romantic and classy setting.
venue_dna_review:
This iconic restaurant situated in a Victorian house in the heart of Yorkville offers French inspired Canadian cuisine in a romantic and classy setting. It's yellow exterior is familiar with many who have strolled through the idillic Yorkville streets by Cumberland and Bellair. Once ruined by a fire, Sassafraz has emerged better than ever.

They offer a fantastic weekend brunch, lunch and dinner menu, along with an extensive cocktail menu for drinks after your meal at the adjoining S-Cafe Bar. There, they serve multiple shared dishes and cheese plates for those who simply want to stop by for a small nibble and a drink, while people watching (many celebrities have been spotted here).

Sassafraz is definitely for those with deep pockets, as one meal can really put a dent in your wallet. However, it's a great anniversary location which will surely impress your date.

venue_dna_excerpt: Soak in the art and culture at this Toronto landmark for free every Wednesday evenings from 6 p.m. to 8:30 p.m.
venue_dna_review:
Visit the Art Gallery of Ontario for free every Wednesday evenings from 6 p.m. to 8:30 p.m.

This Toronto landmark holds more than 79,000 works in its collections spanning from 100 A.D. to the present. Make a date out of this fascinating gallery, where you and your partner can explore the wonderful art and soak in the culture.

The AGO is one of the largest art museums in North America, so you definitely will not be bored perusing through all the different sections hand in hand, and discovering the next great piece of art that's just around each corner.

The AGO is also home to Frank Restaurant for full service dining, as well as CafeAGO for casual dining and an Expresso Bar for light stacks during your visit.

venue_post_title: Toronto's Best Comedy Secret - Ghost Jail Theatre
venue_dna_excerpt: A bit divey, but that's a part of the charm.  It's part of Clinton's Tavern - a bar where you can have a drink right after the show.
venue_dna_review:
One of Toronto's best kept comedy secrets, Ghost Jail Theatre is in their third year running and have been creating laughs out of thin air with their improv magic.

Made up of a mix and mash of Toronto's finest comedic talent trained at top notch improv schools such as The Second City and Impatient Theatre Co., Ghost Jail Theatre is a motley crew of sorts that will make you laugh till you lose your shorts.

The venue in inside the Clinton Tavern, a somewhat divey bar with loads of character located in the Koreatown area of downtown Toronto. If you're looking for a quick budget date, with great entertainment and cheap booze, then this is the place for you.

Please Share on Facebook, Retweet or Stumble it if you liked this date idea :)

venue_dna_excerpt: Bad Dog Theatre has been a mainstay in the improv and comedy scene for decades and is nestled right at the edge of the city's popular Greektown on the Danforth.
venue_dna_review:
Bad Dog Theatre Company Ð formerly known as ÒTheatreSports TorontoÓ has been a mainstay in the improv and comedy scene for decades and is nestled right at the edge of Greektown on the Danforth right by Broadview.

They have pumped out the likes of Toronto Second City alumnus Kerry Griffin, Rob Baker and Reid Janisse. A different show is presented each night, with Saturday being their main draw for their ÒTheatreSportsÓ show where teams battle it out for the most laughs. While the price they charge is nominal, theyÕre definitely big on laughs.

Being located in one of the city's most popular ethnic enclaves also serves as a great date spot, as there are tons of places for you and your date to go out and grab at drink at one of the many Greektown patios, and restaurants, many which are open until the wee hours of the night on weekends.

venue_dna_excerpt: The Comedy Bar features a nice mix of traditional stand-up comedy and spontaneous improv comedy.
venue_dna_review:
The Comedy Bar Ð located in the west end of Toronto features a nice mix between traditional stand-up comedy and spontaneous improv comedy. This is home of some of the best improv troupes in Toronto, Big in Japan and the Sketchersons.

Tickets are reasonably priced at only $8. They offer basic pub-fare grubs such as wings and pizza and live entertainment every night, as well as a comfy lounge for drinks and relaxing.

venue_dna_excerpt: Great for a casual date and those who are looking to laugh till their sides hurt at a great price point.
venue_dna_review:
This is one of the smaller comedy clubs in Toronto and is perfect for a cozier comedy experience. Absolute Comedy has a convenient location north of the intersection of Yonge & Eglinton, offering fantastic and reasonably priced pub grub and drink.

They offer special dinner and show packages for as low as $20, so for those looking for a all-in-one date on a budget with entertainment and eats, this is the place to go. Keep in mind reservations are required, since they need to organize your meal prior to the show.

They certainly don't skimp on the laughs and the comedic talent they attract, so expect a great show!

venue_dna_excerpt: An adorable little corner bakery cafe, serving up an amazing brunch, along with decadent croissants, pastries and baked goods.
venue_dna_review:
Having been told many times that they make an awesome brunch and bake the best croissants in the city (in house), their almond, lemon and chocolate versions of the fluffy pastry is to die for.

Bonjour Brioche is quite small and very quiet, providing a great environment for intimate conversation and relaxing with the aroma of fresh baked-goods floating all around you. One reminder though - they only take cash as a form of payment  so be prepared but they do have an ATM located at the lower level of the restaurant.

venue_dna_excerpt: School Bakery & Cafe is one hotspot for weekend brunch so arrive early to avoid a long wait.
venue_dna_review:
ocated on a quiet street in Liberty Village, School Bakery & Cafe is a hotspot for weekend brunch known by many Torontonians so arrive early to avoid a long wait but this may be inevitable, and they don't take brunch reservations. However, they do take reservations for dinner which is served Wednesday to Sunday 5 p.m. to 11 p.m.

ThereÕs a large patio out front and at the back, while the inside also includes a large seating area, with an open concept design. However, the tables are set pretty close to one another, and is often packed to the brim inside and out.

The wait-staff dress in cute school-like uniforms, and thereÕs school decor all around, hence the name. Portions are a bit on the tiny side, but the food is delicious and fresh. For a small nibble, try their fresh scones.

Service is questionable. Maybe the staff are rammed, but the food came fast, but you will have to wave your arms dramatically in order to flag down your server to get condiments or extra napkins, so best to ask for it all right when your meal arrives if they're not already on your table.  You may not see your server again until your ask for your check.

venue_post_title: Aroma Espresso Bar in the Annex
venue_dna_excerpt: Aroma differentiates itself from its competitors by offering a plethora of cappuccinos, coffee options and a charming atmosphere.
venue_dna_review:
Although there are now multiple Aroma Expresso Bar locations in Toronto, the cafe located on the northwest corner of Bloor and Albany in the Annex is truly still the one location which is totally date worthy.

With its expansive outdoor patio located along a shady side street, and comfy seating all around it's interior, Aroma differentiates itself from its competitors by offering a plethora of cappuccinos, coffee options and a charming atmosphere. They like to make things personal, by asking for your name with your order, which is a nice touch from the everyday rush.

Try one of their chocolate based drinks, such as the mocha or hot chocolate, which is made with real chocolate and delicious. Remember to give it a good stir to get all the chocolate off the bottom of get the full aromatic flavour of the drink.

Aroma is welcomed departure from the usual coffee chains located at every corner in the city.

venue_dna_excerpt: Known as an institution in the Annex is embraced by city and coveted by students for its generous portions.  It is also widely known for its borscht, perogies, brunch and sangria & drinks on their awesome patio.
venue_dna_review: Known as an institution in the Annex is embraced by city and coveted by students for its generous portions. It is also widely known for its borscht, perogies, brunch and sangria & drinks on their awesome patio. ÒFuturesÓ is definitely a great spot to soak up the Annex atmosphere while enjoying the company of your date or friends.

venue_dna_excerpt: There are no surprises at Pauper's Pub. ItÕs what you would expect of a traditional neighbourhood pub, providing a cozy dimly lit environment, great for casual conversations over a few pints of beer.
venue_dna_review:
There are no surprises at Pauper's Pub. ItÕs what you would expect of a traditional neighbourhood pub, providing a cozy dimly lit environment, great for casual conversations over a few pints of beer and some low-fuss  pub grub.

The best part of PauperÕs Pub is that they have a roomy side patio and even a rooftop patio to chill out and soak up the sun and city sounds during those warm and bustling summer months. The pub is conveniently located one block east of Bathurst and Bloor and the subway station in the Annex neighbourhood, where there are always lots of interesting people roaming the streets

venue_dna_excerpt: A great spot known for its brunches  and Middle Eastern fare, By the Way Cafe has been attracting crowds from all walks of life since the 1970s.
venue_dna_review:
A great spot known for its brunches  and Middle Eastern fare, By the Way Cafe has been attracting crowds from all walks of life since the 1970s and is is located right in the superbly vibrant neighbourhood of the Annex.

The cafe offers a relax environment and great food at a reasonable price point, along with a colorful mural painted all along it's main wall. They change their dinner specials nightly, so every visit will be filled with an expectation of something yummy and new.

If you prefer eating outside, the cafe includes a canopied patio for you to sit in the shade while people watching and enjoying a delicious meal.

venue_dna_excerpt: This new creation from Oliver and Bonacini Restaurants offers a hassle-free dining experience in the Entertainment District. Expect a delicious meal at an attractive price point.
venue_dna_review:
One of Oliver & Bonacini Restaurants' newest openings, O&B Canteen is an open concept restaurant with towering ceilings and a focus on casual eats that attracts a diverse crowd from families, Bay streeters to theatre goers in the area.

Located at the brand new Bell Lightbox, the new home of TIFF, their mantra for their menu is simplicity at an attractive price point. Canteen is headed by former Auberge du Pommier Chef, Jason Bangerter.

Expect nothing less than fantastic and prompt service, and quality meals that won't disappoint.

venue_dna_excerpt: A great spot for vegetarians cuisine, with multiple convenient locations around the city Fresh is a vegetarian's haven.
venue_dna_review:
You won't find anything that would clog your arteries at Fresh Restaurant and Juice Bar. A casual spot for guilt free dining, known for their gourmet vegetarian dishes, frrom soups, tasty veggie bowls, healthy wraps, salads, gourmet veggie burgers and smoothies, Fresh is a vegetarian's haven.

For those who seek value, they also have a prix fixe offering. With locations across Toronto, it's clearly a sign their popularity and their presence is appreciated in the city, where a vast choice of good vegetarian fare if often lacking.

Want to up your veggie street cred? Challenge each other to a "cleansing" shot of wheat grass :)

venue_dna_excerpt: Great venue for an Japanese Omakase experience, heralded as one of the best in Toronto and providing a fantastic vibe for those looking for a foodie experience with romance.
venue_dna_review:
Yuzu has become one of the darlings of the hardcore Japanese cuisine enthusiasts and foodies in Toronto. From the same owners of Japango, Yuzu is located in the heart of the clubbing district and has all the hallmarks of a great restaurant to visit. The venue has amazing ambiance, great detail, attentive service and authentic approach to Japanese cuisine.

They have an extensive sake selection and the highlight of their menu is their Omakase offering - a menu that is personally crafted and chosen by the chef. The omakase is heralded as one of the best across Toronto, but comes at $70 - well worth the price if you're looking for a fantastic experience in a warm and romantic Japanese restaurant. They also offer an extensive la carte and bento boxes as well.

And a fun fact, incase you're wondering what a Yuzu is... it's the Japanese word for "grapefruit"!

venue_dna_excerpt: Create a memorable experience with your date at a restaurant where you're forced to rely on senses besides your sight to "feel" through your meal.
venue_dna_review:
O.NOIR, Toronto's first and only "dining in the dark" restaurant.  While a bit gimmicky, the concept is novel for people looking for a memorable experience.  While a bit disorienting at first, dining in the dark heightens your other senses.  You're forced to rely on your other senses and "feel" through your meal and your date.  You'll cherish the experience more because you're using your other senses to a greater degree and as such conversation is simply energized.

Definitely a fun and exciting experience, sharing in laughs and fumbling with your food - just try not to feed your date to avoiding poking their eye out ;)

venue_dna_excerpt: Sultan's Tent provides the the entire Moroccan cuisine and entertainment experience - complete with belly dancers and luxurious setting and decor.
venue_dna_review:
Sultan's Tent provides the the entire Moroccan culinary and entertainment experience - complete with belly dancers and luxurious setting and decor.  There's something seductive about the environment or maybe it's the sharing and experiencing exotic food and culture that's immersive.  You can choose to sit at traditional table, but the main draw of Sultan's Tent is not the food or even the belly dancers - it has to do with the abilities of dining within a plush tent with plenty of throw pillows, which definitely aids an air of intimacy, luxury and abundance.

They have a prix fixe menu starting at $40 for the adventurous and indecisive.  Currently they have their "Moroclicious" promotion with lunch and dinner prix fixe as well.  Be sure to make a reservation as the entertainment only occurs at set times. What's holding you back from trying out The Sultan's Tent?

venue_dna_excerpt: A cute and charming little restaurant that's known for its brunch and even better known for attracting A-List celebrities like Clive Owen and Julia Roberts due to its proximity to the film studios on Eastern Ave.
venue_dna_review:
Known for its brunch and even better known for attracting A-List celebrities like Clive Owen and Julia Roberts due to its proximity to the film studios on Eastern Ave. One thing that you will immediately notice upon entering their cozy restaurant is the number of toasters prominently displayed around the restaurant. The fun fact about them is they're autographed by celebrities which are a testament to the popularity of this spot in the neighbourhood of Leslieville.

Toast Restaurant has a charming atmosphere, friendly wait-staff, awesome brunch and dinner menus and a decent wine list.  With all that's going for Toast,

venue_dna_excerpt: Patrons flock to Remy's due to their expansive patio to soak up the sun over a few glasses of sangria, draft beers, cocktails or wine.
venue_dna_review:
Feels like a spot hidden away from the city with access only through a lane in the Yorkville area, Remy's has an Italian inspired menu with an extensive wine selection and cocktails as well.

Definitely upscale considering it's swanky surroundings with prices that fit accordingly to the neighbourhood. Patrons flock to Remy's for their expansive patio (Yorkville's largest it claims) to soak up the sun over a few glasses of sangria, draft beers, cocktails or wine.

venue_dna_excerpt: A popular local hangout in the swanky neighbourhood of Yorkville that has Aussie and Kiwi roots. ÊIt has one of the best patios in Toronto, and is most suitable for a casual date after work over a pint or a glass of wine.
venue_dna_review:
A popular local hangout in the swanky neighbourhood of Yorkville, Hemingways is a bar with Aussie and Kiwi roots.

It has one of the best patios in Toronto and is most suitable for a casual date after work over a pint or a glass of wine.  Hemingway's gives off a friendly and non-pretentious vibe, perfect for a casual and low-key first date.

venue_dna_excerpt: A  lively, fun, easy-going and casual place, the Rivoli is jack of all trades in terms of venues, with a patio, pool hall, live music, stand-up comedy, good eats and plenty of beers on tap.
venue_dna_review: A local favourite in the  Queen West area, The Rivoli has carved out a space in Torontonians hearts since opening back in 1982. The Rivoli is a jack of all trades in terms of venues with a patio, pool tables upstairs, live music, stand-up comedy, good eats and plenty of beers on tap. It's a great starting point or ending point if you're going for a date in the area and looking for a place that's lively, easy-going and casual.

venue_dna_excerpt: An Indian restaurant that provides a romantic vibe with authentic Indian fare that will make you salivate.
venue_dna_review:
Featured on FoodTVÕs ÒRestaurant MakeoverÓ, this trendy Indian restaurant located on the King West strip by King and John Streets has garnered a loyal following after appearing on the show.

Known for their Authentic Indian Cuisine, Dhaba certainly doesnÕt disappoint in delivering value to your tastebuds and tummy. This Indian restaurant will surely provide you with a romantic vibe along with their authentic Indian fare that will make you salivate.

venue_dna_excerpt: One of the most romantic vegan restaurants in Toronto - offers tapas style plates for you and your date to share.  Dripping with atmosphere and with a great location in downtown Toronto.
venue_dna_review:
One of the foremost vegan restaurants in Toronto, Fressen is dimly lit and exudes a warm vibe thatÕs conducive to connecting with your date or friends. Fressen provides a tapas-style menu items that provides generous portions and never exceeds $9. This might tempt you into trying out their entire menu, which is a good or bad thing depending which way you look at it.

Besides being a vegan restaurant, they source organic food whenever possible which allows animal lovers and the environmentally conscious to breath easy. It also allows Fressen to claim the title as ÒBest Guilt FreeÓ restaurant in Toronto.

venue_dna_excerpt: One of the hidden gems of Toronto, Batifole (which means "to frolicÓ) is known for the ÒBest French food in ChinatownÓ because of their location in close proximity to Chinatown East.
venue_dna_review:
One of the hidden gems of Toronto, Batifole (which means "to frolicÓ) is known for the ÒBest French food in ChinatownÓ because of their location in close proximity to Chinatown East. Batifole has won accolades from critics and won over Foodies in Toronto for their authentic French cuisine made by Chef Texier - a former Chef at Sassafraz.

One of the defining traits of Batifole is their impeccable service. If youÕre looking for fresh and memorable dining experience at exceptional value, check out Batifole.

venue_dna_excerpt: Nominated as one of the most romantic lounges in Toronto, with a great menu and cocktail list, Panorama is nestled away on the 51st floor of the Manulife Centre and holds a breath-taking view over the city.
venue_dna_review:
Nominated as one of the most romantic lounges in all of Toronto, Panorama is nestled away on the 51st floor of the Manulife Centre and holds a commanding view over the city. Take in the city lights while sipping away on drinks from their award winning cocktail menu.

They also have a full dinner menu and extensive dessert menu. Be sure to call in for reservations as the demand for seating is greater than the amount than they have, especially on the weekend.

Keep in mind, this is a very high-end place, so dress to impress!

venue_dna_excerpt: Cozy little Japanese restaurant that's right behind City Hall.  A favourite among City of Toronto employees, Ryerson, OCAD and UofT students.  Serves some of the best authentic sushi at an attractive price point.
venue_dna_review:
Japango has sushi and Japanese cuisine lovers ranting and raving for their impeccable food. Conveniently tucked away behind City Hall on Elizabeth St and Dundas St. W in the heart of the downtown Toronto, Japango has quite the following.

This is especially true during the lunch time rush where the local crowd fills the venue to capacity.Ð partly because of their ability to seat no more than 20 people at once, which is also a major drawback.

If you can snag seats, youÕll be delighted by their approach to Japanese cuisine, which is a nice departure from the plethora of other so-called ÒJapaneseÓ restaurants in Toronto.

If you become one of their loyal patrons, they will treat you as such and even reserve you a pair of chopsticks with your name prominently displayed on their ÒWall of Recognition.Ó

venue_dna_excerpt: Home to Toronto's premier Mixologists and Cocktail chefs, BarChef takes on an innovative approach to mixology and creating drink experiences that are unforgettable for those into the exciting Toronto bar scene.
venue_dna_review:
Home to Toronto's premier Mixologists and Cocktail chefs, BarChef takes on an innovative approach to mixology and creating drink experiences that are unforgettable for those into the exciting Toronto bar scene.

It takes time effort and skill for the mixologists to create your drink, so don't expect to be getting your standard "rye and gin". In fact, if you order it - they will insist that they don't serve those drinks and instead gently guide you to experience a cocktail more suitable for your palette.

The cocktails are a bit on the dramatic side, so expect a great show just from watching the mixologists create your drink. The menu is extensive and a bit much for first timers, but it's guaranteed to give you and your date an amazing and fun experience tasting the different drinks available.

venue_dna_excerpt: Still using the same signage back when it was a butcher shop back in 1924, Czehoski is anything but a butcher shop nowadays. This trendy yet understated restaurant is one of the top to-go destinations for food and drink in West Queen West area.
venue_dna_review:
Still using the same signage back when it was a butcher shop back in 1924, Czehoski is anything but a butcher shop nowadays. This trendy yet understated restaurant is one of the top to-go destinations for food and drink in West Queen West area.

Czehoski has a split-personalities. One, being a restaurant serving up warm and hearty dishes such as burgers and mac and cheese and at night, turns into a lounge with DJ's spinning tunes till the wee hours of the morning and patrons enjoying one of their many great cocktails and beers. It takes on all personalities remarkably well.

Czehoski is perfect for a sit down meal of comfort food and as well, for drinks with friends or with a date. The front of the restaurant is where the spin-table and bar is, so it's bound to be a tad louder. For more privacy and quiet, head to the back.

venue_dna_excerpt: Spice Route provides a fantastic atmosphere for drinking, dining and lounging, serving Asian-fusion cuisine. Don't forget to visit the restrooms so see something cool.
venue_dna_review:
Spice Route provides a fantastic atmosphere for drinking, dining and lounging. The restaurant serves up mouth-watering Asian-fused cuisine, with a twist, as well, the cocktails are to die for, such as the Sake Sangria.

This spacious Asian-themed restaurant is dimly light with romantic warm lighted, and decorated with stylish decor, as well as large comfortable tables and plush seating. There is a side patio filled with covered verandas and sectional seating, which is very popular with patrons during the summers who like to stand around, sipping their drinks and striking up conversation.

The restaurant has some of the most stylish looking washrooms in all of Toronto, with fun one-sided mirrors, where you can see everybody outside on the patio, yet they can't look in.

Prone to attracting the "Bay St. type" and the super chic, this is definitely a date spot that will impress with a classy and modern touch.

venue_dna_excerpt: If youÕre looking for a classy, intimate, romantic and extravagant place to dine, then look no further than Sen5es Restaurant at the Soho Metropolitan Hotel.
venue_dna_review:
If youÕre looking for a classy, intimate, romantic and extravagant place to dine, then look no further than Sen5es Restaurant at the Soho Metropolitan Hotel.
The dining room is spacious and beautifully decorated, with natural light spilling  onto the eateryÕs espresso oak hardwood floors and neutral-toned walls, helping create a warm and soft glow throughout.

A fresh basket of bread with smoked salmon spread and olives was first delivered to our table by our waiter, who was professional, polite, and knowledgeable about the restaurant and the dishes served that night. We started by ordering the Pan Seared Sea Scallops ($14) and Truffle Fries with Truffle Mayonnaise ($7).

For mains, we ordered a Torched Salmon, Red Tuna and Hamachi trio with Wasabi Asparagus Risotto ($33), which was seared just enough to let the warm fish melt in the mouth. We also ordered a Glazed Salmon with Vegetables ($24), plated beautifully to resemble a blooming flower.

For dessert, our waiter recommended to us the Creme Brulee Quad ($10), which is a perfect dessert for sharing. This comprised of four mini creme brulees in the flavours of vanilla, espresso, ginger and chocolate.

Although an evening at Sen5es will definitely put a bit of a dent on your wallet, this is the perfect spot to celebrate relationship milestones or for those special dates. The service and food was impeccable, living us to the reputation of the hotel the restaurant is attached to.

After a delightful and satisfying meal, head over to the Sen5es Lounge, which is open until 1 a.m. and continue your date over cocktails.

Average cost of 3 course dinner for 2: $100 (before tax/tip/alcohol)
(Note: Menu offerings change daily)

Please ÒLikeÓ or Share this on Facebook, Retweet or Stumble it if you like this review

venue_dna_excerpt: Adorable restaurant with great food, quick service, decent prices and intimate but tight seating, located in a fantastic Little Italy section of the city, with lots to see and do after a meal. Great spot for brunch, popular with many in the city.
venue_dna_review:
Kalendar sits among the rows of yummy eateries along College Street, but what makes it stand out is its beautiful front patio, situated right next to the busy sidewalk, yet it's closed off from from the intrusion of passerbys, surrounded by flowers and greenery. The venue is usually packed to the max on Sunday mornings, but the staff are quick and attentive. Give a little bit of patience and you will be seated in no time.

However, everything in the restaurant is a tight squeeze, even the tables and chairs. One one hand, it gives you and your brunch date a cozy feeling, dining over their scrumptious selection of brunch goodies. On the other, you better suck in your gut to get in and around the tables or you will knock your coffee over.

Whether you're going for brunch, lunch or dinner during rain, shine, cold or patio weather, you can't go wrong with a visit to Kalendar Restaurant and Bistro.

You can check out their full menu online.

venue_dna_excerpt: This quaint and charming wine bar in Leslieville is the perfect romantic escape for you and your date, with a location that gives you that feeling of being hidden away from the rest of the world.
venue_dna_review:
Swirl Wine Bar has a quaint and charming feel partly due to being located on the top floor of a building, hidden away from the rest of the world Ð perfect for a romantic escape from the busy sidewalks down below for you and your date.

Swirl just has a way of making you feel connection with your date, whether it's their friendly but in-intrusive stuff, small cozy space, which makes large crowds impossible, or their unique artwork hanging all around the place.

Dimly lit with the added ambiance of candlelight, their sommelier has carefully chosen a wine menu for those who have the most discerning palate. heir menu features various charcuterie and fresh breads to accompany your wine. Swirl Wine Bar is truly is a ÒhiddenÓ gem in Leslieville.

venue_dna_excerpt: Kalendar sits among the rows of yummy eateries along College Street, but what makes it stand out is its beautiful front patio, situated right next to the busy sidewalk, yet it's closed off from from the intrusion of passerbys.
venue_dna_review:
Kalendar sits among the rows of yummy eateries along College Street, but what makes it stand out is its beautiful front patio, situated right next to the busy sidewalk, yet it's closed off from from the intrusion of passerbys, surrounded by flowers and greenery. The venue is usually packed to the max on Sunday mornings, but the staff are quick and attentive. Give a little bit of patience and you will be seated in no time.

However, everything in the restaurant is a tight squeeze, even the tables and chairs. One one hand, it gives you and your brunch date a cozy feeling, dining over their scrumptious selection of brunch goodies. On the other, you better suck in your gut to get in and around the tables or you will knock your coffee over.

Whether you're going for brunch, lunch or dinner during rain, shine, cold or patio weather, you can't go wrong with a visit to Kalendar Restaurant and Bistro.

venue_dna_excerpt: A beautiful and simplistic cafe situated on a busy store-lined street, yet the cafŽ gives off a light, relaxing, warm and welcoming vibe the moment you step through the door.
venue_dna_review:
Leslieville coffee darling Te Aro Roasted has graced the hip neighbourhood of Ossington in the West End by opened up a charming new cafŽ called CRAFTED.

The beautiful, yet simplistic spot is situated on a busy store-lined street, buzzing with rumbling traffic and people, yet the cafŽ gives off a light, relaxing, warm and welcoming vibe the moment you step through the door.

The best spot to sit with your date, while sipping on one of their fresh aromatic coffees and munching on a rich brownie is the front counter situated under their full slide-up window-- a signature design touch they have brought over from Te Aro. This spot gives you a perfect airy view of the street and neighbourhood scenery. But for more privacy, head to the back where you can lounge on their cushioned benches, leaning against one of their plush pillows.

The cafŽ will soon open up a uber-private outdoor patio at the back. This beautiful secluded spot is surrounded by a fresh vegetable garden, hidden away from the busy streets and noise out front.

The name CRAFTED was selected because the cafŽ practices different brewing methods, thus, ÒcraftingÓ coffee. So far, they offer extracted coffee, French press, pour-over, Espresso, brewed, and will be introducing a couple of others in the coming months. CRAFTED will surely impress even the most experienced coffee connoisseurs in the city.

venue_dna_excerpt: While strolling through the pedestrian-only cobblestone streets in the district, and stepping foot into their two storey coffee house, you get a distinctly ÒOld European Parisian feelÓ, adding to the vibe and ambiance of this historic site. Time just flows a little slower when taken in by the design of the building.
venue_dna_review:
Balzac's Coffee Roastery is located in the Old Pump House in the Historic Distillery District. Their coffee philosophy is simple: ÒServe an exceptional product in a beautiful environmentÓ.

While strolling through the pedestrian-only cobblestone streets in the district, and stepping foot into their two-storey coffee house, you get a distinctly ÒOld European Parisian feelÓ, adding to the vibe and ambiance of this historic site. Time just flows a little slower when taken in by the design of the building.

Outside of BalzacÕs is a sprawling patio that spills over to the Distillery DistrictÕs main patio area. For coffee lovers, youÕll be pleased to know the cafe is "vertically integrated", meaning they control the quality of their beans and donÕt order from just anyone.

Even if itÕs for a quick stopover to relax, refuel or recharge, youÕll be glad you discovered this secluded hidden-away date spot in a beautiful part of the downtown core, away from heavy traffic and crowds.

venue_dna_excerpt: The latest addition of bars to Leslieville. It is out to provide a spot thatÕs unique for the burgeoning neighbourhood of young professionals and creative types, providing them with a chic yet casual spot to entertain friends or to meet new ones after work.
venue_dna_review:
Waylabar (short for "What Are You Looking At?") is the latest addition of bars to Leslieville. It is out to provide a spot thatÕs unique for the burgeoning neighbourhood of young professionals and creative types, providing them with a chic yet casual spot to entertain friends or to meet new ones after work.

The space exudes the feeling of comfort, style and elegance. The design of Waylabar was kept in mind so that the mood of the bar changes as you walk through it.

There are comfy benches situated in the middle of the bar, giving off a living room kind of feeling, while the back is where all the action happens. ThereÕs a DJ booth, lengthy bar (that looks like a library for liqueurs), a lounge area and mini-dance floor. If youÕre partial to sipping martinis or beers under the sun, there's a small patio out back.

Their extensive wine collection is also complimented by their charcuterie plates, if you're looking for something to nibble on while you relax.

venue_dna_excerpt: This huge venue is equipped with a large breezy rooftop patio, as well as comfortable patio seating on the main level, all hidden away from the busy King West main street, but convenient enough to be reached via public transit.
venue_dna_review: This huge venue is equipped with a large breezy rooftop patio, as well as comfortable patio seating on the main level, all hidden away from the busy King West main street, but convenient enough to be reached via public transit.

venue_dna_excerpt: Beautiful and new Japanese restaurant with great food and service. It's far from downtown, but if you're from uptown, perfect spot, granted you have a car, and want to stay in one place for the night. A few bars and a dessert place can be found after a short drive around the area.
venue_dna_review:
Inatei Japanese Cuisine is a rare find in Richmond Hill, an area in the GTA which is usually dominated by stereotypical greasy spoon Asian restaurants.

We wandered into this spot for lunch at the recommendation of a friend, and was impressed by the food, service and the look of the restaurant itself.

We ordered two Udon noodle lunch specials ($9.99 each). The noodles were succulently slippery and smooth, sitting in a flavourful broth. One meal came with a crispy side of pork Katsu, which was cooked perfectly, without being overly greasy. Each set meal was also accompanied by a spring mix green salad with Japanese vinaigrette dressing, a miso soup and for dessert, a tofu mousse with jelly fruit topping. We also upgraded to a Spider Roll maki for $2 extra.

We were impressed by the presentation of the meals, which were decorated with creative garnishes even for a simple Sunday lunch. The waiters were quick, friendly, attentive, but non-intrusive, which is rare in an area where customer service in restaurants is usually not a high priority.

The 10-month old restaurant itself is very spacious with sky-high ceilings and soft lighting, complimented by comfortable booth seating with floral backrests. The eatery is surrounded by a very usual stone wall design, which gives you a relaxed feeling of being at a hot spring, and sipping on green tea.

The venue is hard to find, located in a plaza on a quieter part of Leslie Street, just intersecting Highway 7. Pay attention, or youÕll miss it in a flash, but you will surely be glad you found it after sitting down for a lunch or dinner.

venue_type: coffee & tea, bars, lounges, breakfast & brunch
venue_dna_excerpt: Part boutique, part bakery and part cafe lounge, Spice Safar is the perfect coffee date/lounge spot if you're looking for a place that is chic, glamourous, sexy, and located along King Street West.
venue_dna_review:
Part boutique, part bakery and part cafe lounge, Spice Safar is the perfect coffee date/lounge spot if you're looking for a place that is chic, glamourous, sexy, and located along King Street West next to the many bars, restaurants and lounges in this lively and upscale entertainment area.

What separates Spice Safar a part from other eateries is its drive to provide patrons with a sense of affordable luxury despite being located amongst upscale establishments, but this cafe is not your average local coffee hangout. Upon entering, you will notice the cafe's high ceilings, and warm wood-panelled walls complimented by soft lighting and decorated with stylish black and white artwork hanging around the room.

Friendly servers are behind the counter ready to serve you a fantastic cup of espresso, cappuccino or Americano. Each coffee drink is paired with a shot of sparkling water and a decadent mini chocolate macaron. They also serve fresh baked goods, such as danishes, biscuits and muffins to name a few.

Place your order and head own into the lowered seating area and make yourself comfortable. Your server will bring you your order when it's ready. You can see the cafe is furnished with plush benches all around and low wooden tables, with many private and cozy corners for you to tuck yourself and your date away for an intimate conversation.

By night, this spot also turns into a hip, relaxing and convenient spot for drinks and tapas with friends. One of the quirks we really liked about this place was that the washrooms were unisex, which can really drive one's imagination during a seductive conversation over drinks.

Spice Safar has recently expanded to serve weekend brunch

venue_dna_excerpt: If you're the adventurous type looking for some flipping good fun and want to try something affordable yet unique, than this drop-in trapeze class is for you.
venue_dna_review:
The Toronto School of Circus Arts offers a drop-in Flying Trapeze class every friday for only $25 per person.

What can be more exciting and heart-thumping than taking your date somewhere where you will literally sweep them off their feet (well, an instructor will actually:). If you're the adventurous type looking for some flipping good fun and want to try something affordable yet unique, than this drop-in trapeze class is for you.

INFORMATION:

Friday Flying Trapeze 
Time: 7 p.m.
Cost for 2: $50 (25.00 Cash/Person)

This Flying Trapeze class is for anyone. Minimum age is 7 years. Length of the class is 1, 1 1Ú2 or 2-hours and is based on the number of participants each Friday. Registration is on site prior to the class on the date you will be participating. Registration begins at 6:30pm and closes at 6:50pm $25 cash per person. Participants under 18 years of age must be accompanied by their own parent for the duration of this class.

This class may not be offered every Friday. Please email to confirm dates for the current month: info@torontocircus.com

venue_dna_excerpt: Visiting the Mediatheque is a great way to discover something new and entertaining, with their growing library of more than 5,500 free films.
venue_dna_review:
Drop by the NFB Mediatheque to enjoy the growing library of more than 5,500 free NFB films in their state-of-the-art Digital Viewing Stations.

Visiting the Mediatheque is a great way to discover something new and entertaining, as well as appreciate the talents of Canadian filmmakers and performers. New titles are added regularly, and guided viewing lists of staff picks will help get you started with the best the NFB has to offer.

venue_post_title: Wine Tastings and Cooking Classes at the LCBO
venue_name: Wine Tastings and Cooking Classes at the LCBO
venue_dna_excerpt: An engaging class for you and your date to learn, share and push your culinary boundaries together.
venue_dna_review:
and explore the finer things in life with tutored wine tastings and cooking classes at the LCBO.  Events run throughout the year.  Whether it's developing your palate for white wines, tasting reds from South America or the Okanagan, the experience of learning and sharing something new together will make for a fun and memorable date.

Discover Wine Appreciation Courses:

The popular LCBO Wine Appreciation Series has been redesigned to offer greater flexibility while retaining its comfortable yet informative approach to understanding wine. The Series is divided into three, four-night sessions including Introduction to Wine Appreciation, Wines of the Old World, and Wines of the New World.

Whether youÕre an interested novice or a seasoned pro looking for a ÒrefresherÓ, the LCBOÕs Wine Appreciation Series is for you.

The Wine Appreciation Series classes are offered at the following LCBO store locations and require pre-registration for participation.

Discover Cooking Classes:

LCBO Cooking Classes offer you the opportunity to learn how to prepare some of your favourite menus. These classes are coordinated by our excellent team of culinary experts. Cooking Classes include a small food sample of each dish and a wine match for some of the menu selected by our Product Consultants.

LCBO Cooking Classes are currently conducted in the following select stores and require pre-registration for participation.

Classes take place at various locations and the schedule varies depending on time of year, so be sure to check out to check out LCBO's website.
